page.title: 18Cycling Proficiency in Voe.
page.content: During the summer term children who are over nine years of age are offered cycling proficiency at the Voe School. Two police constables from the Brae station give the chilren weekly lessons for six weeks.The children bring their bicycles up to school for the lessons and are taught how to control them properly on the road. Practise is given in stopping your bicycle and taking right and left turns. Road safety is also discussed and the Highway Code must be learned. After the six lessons each child is given a practical cycling test followed by an oral test on the Highway Code.A police sergeant comes along to give the test. Those who pass are given a certificate and a badge.
